Description: The Cancer Diagnosis Program of the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis strives to improve diagnosis and assessment of cancer by effectively moving new scientific knowledge into clinical practice. While Cancer Diagnosis Program is not directly involved with patient care, it stimulates, coordinates and funds research and resources for the development of innovative in vitro diagnostics, novel diagnostic technologies, and appropriate human specimens to better characterize cancers and allow improved medical decision making and evaluation of response to treatment.This session presents the Cancer Diagnosis Program initiatives, funding opportunities and resources including biospecimens from the Cooperative Human Tissue Network and NCI-National Clinical Trials Network Biospecimen Banks, molecular characterization and validation of biomarkers and clinical assays, that are available to investigators.

Title: NCI-Cancer Diagnosis Program Initiatives, Funding Opportunities and Resources for Investigators
